title: I tried AIRE Ancient Baths' luxury spa before its Canadian debut
description: Toronto's new wellness sanctuary is inspired by old Roman bathing rituals, but it started in Spain

title: Manufacturing Religious Illegitimacy: How Modern States Neutralize Ancient Institutions—The Ethiopian Orthodox Church Under Abiy Ahmed
description: The HabeshaJanuary 19, 2026 Author: Caleb Ta. (Dr.) Affiliation: Independent Researcher in African Political Affairs; Human Rights Advocate Abstract This article develops a political-theoretical analysis of how modern states manufacture religious illegitimacy to neutralize ancient institutions. Using the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church (EOTC) under Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed as a case study, it examines how discourse, policy, media, and coercive power are deployed to fragment, delegitimize, and domesticate a historically sovereign religious institution. The article argues that the Ethiopian state has pursued a systematic campaign to redefine Orthodoxy as politically obstructive, economically unproductive, and culturally regressive, thereby justifying repression and fragmentation.The Habesha Ethiopian News

title: Columbus fossil park awarded $536K grant for kayak, canoe launch
description: The Dr. John “Jack” Kaye Cretaceous Fossil Park is now mostly funded thanks to a grant from the Mississippi Outdoor Stewardship Trust Fund.
